p: Plant description: Celastrus paniculatus ( C. paniculatus) is a large climber of the family Celastraceae. It grows throughout India, on sub-Himalayan slopes and the hilly regions of Punjab and South India. It is commonly known as jyotismati, which comes from the Sanskrit words “jyoti teja” or fire of mind and “mati”—intelligence. Traditionally, the bark and seeds have been used as a brain tonic, to promote intellect and to improve digestion, stimulant and expectorant [ 173]. In Ayurveda, C. paniculatus has been used to treat many diseases like depression, leprosy, paralysis, fever and arthritis. The seed oil and fruit are commonly used for their tranquilizer, sedative and wound healing properties [ 174].
